verses.verse: And Abraham <WH85> was old, <WH2204> and well stricken <WH935> in age: <WH3117> and the LORD <WH3068> had blessed <WH1288> Abraham <WH85> in all <WH3605> things.

And Abraham <WH85> said <WH559> to his oldest <WH2205> servant <WH5650> of his house, <WH1004> that ruled <WH4910> over all <WH3605> that he had, Put, <WH7760> I pray <WH4994> you, your hand <WH3027> under <WH8478> my thigh: <WH3409>

And I will make you swear <WH7650> by the LORD, <WH3068> the God <WH430> of heaven, <WH8064> and the God <WH430> of the earth, <WH776> that you shall not take <WH3947> a wife <WH802> to my son <WH1121> of the daughters <WH1323> of the Canaanites, <WH3669> among <WH7130> whom <WH834> I dwell: <WH3427>
But you shall go <WH3212> to my country, <WH776> and to my kindred, <WH4138> and take <WH3947> a wife <WH802> to my son <WH1121> Isaac. <WH3327>

And the servant <WH5650> said <WH559> to him, Peradventure <WH194> the woman <WH802> will not be willing <WH14> to follow <WH3212> <WH310> me to this <WH2063> land: <WH776> must I needs <WH7725> bring <WH7725> your son <WH1121> again <WH7725> to the land <WH776> from from where <WH834> <WH8033> you came? <WH3318>
And Abraham <WH85> said <WH559> to him, Beware <WH8104> you that you bring <WH7725> not my son <WH1121> thither <WH8033> again. <WH7725>

The LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of heaven, <WH8064> which <WH834> took <WH3947> me from my father's <WH1> house, <WH1004> and from the land <WH776> of my kindred, <WH4138> and which <WH834> spoke <WH1696> to me, and that swore <WH7650> to me, saying, <WH559> To your seed <WH2233> will I give <WH5414> this <WH2063> land; <WH776> he shall send <WH7971> his angel <WH4397> before <WH6440> you, and you shall take <WH3947> a wife <WH802> to my son <WH1121> from there. <WH8033>

And if the woman <WH802> will not be willing <WH14> to follow <WH3212> <WH310> you, then you shall be clear <WH5352> from this my oath: <WH7621> only <WH7535> bring <WH7725> not my son <WH1121> thither again. <WH7725>
And the servant <WH5650> put <WH7760> his hand <WH3027> under <WH8478> the thigh <WH3409> of Abraham <WH85> his master, <WH113> and swore <WH7650> to him concerning <WH5921> that matter. <WH1697>

And the servant <WH5650> took <WH3947> ten <WH6235> camels <WH1581> of the camels <WH1581> of his master, <WH113> and departed; <WH3212> for all <WH3605> the goods <WH2898> of his master <WH113> were in his hand: <WH3027> and he arose, <WH6965> and went <WH3212> to Mesopotamia, <WH763> to the city <WH5892> of Nahor. <WH5152>

And he made his camels <WH1581> to kneel <WH1288> down <WH1288> without <WH2351> the city <WH5892> by a well <WH875> of water <WH4325> at the time <WH6256> of the evening, <WH6153> even the time <WH6256> that women go <WH3318> out to draw <WH7579> water.

And he said <WH559>O LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of my master <WH113> Abraham, <WH85> I pray <WH4994> you, send <WH7136> me good speed <WH7136> this day, <WH3117> and show <WH6213> kindness <WH2617> to my master <WH113> Abraham. <WH85>
Behold, <WH2009> I stand <WH5324> here by the well <WH5869> of water; <WH4325> and the daughters <WH1323> of the men <WH582> of the city <WH5892> come <WH3318> out to draw <WH7579> water: <WH4325>

And let it come <WH1961> to pass, that the damsel <WH5291> to whom <WH834> I shall say, <WH559> Let <WH5186> down <WH5186> your pitcher, <WH3537> I pray <WH4994> you, that I may drink; <WH8354> and she shall say, <WH559> Drink, <WH8354> and I will give your camels <WH1581> drink <WH8248> also: <WH1571> let the same be she that you have appointed <WH3198> for your servant <WH5650> Isaac; <WH3327> and thereby shall I know <WH3045> that you have showed <WH6213> kindness <WH2617> to my master. <WH113>

And it came <WH1961> to pass, before <WH2962> he had done <WH3615> speaking, <WH1696> that, behold, <WH2009> Rebekah <WH7259> came <WH3318> out, who <WH834> was born <WH3205> to Bethuel, <WH1328> son <WH1121> of Milcah, <WH4435> the wife <WH802> of Nahor, <WH5152> Abraham's <WH85> brother, <WH251> with her pitcher <WH3537> on her shoulder. <WH7926>

And the damsel <WH5291> was very <WH3966> fair <WH2896> to look <WH4758> on, a virgin, <WH1330> neither <WH3808> had any man <WH376> known <WH3045> her: and she went <WH3381> down <WH3381> to the well, <WH5869> and filled <WH4390> her pitcher, <WH3537> and came <WH5927> up.
And the servant <WH5650> ran <WH7323> to meet <WH7125> her, and said, <WH559> Let me, I pray <WH4994> you, drink <WH1572> a little <WH4592> water <WH4325> of your pitcher. <WH3537>
And she said, <WH559> Drink, <WH8354> my lord: <WH113> and she hurried, <WH4116> and let <WH3381> down <WH3381> her pitcher <WH3537> on her hand, <WH3027> and gave him drink. <WH8248>

And when she had done <WH3615> giving him drink, <WH8248> she said, <WH559> I will draw <WH7579> water for your camels <WH1581> also, <WH1571> until <WH5704> <WH515> they have done <WH3615> drinking. <WH8354>

And she hurried, <WH4116> and emptied <WH6168> her pitcher <WH3537> into <WH413> the trough, <WH8268> and ran <WH7323> again <WH5750> to the well <WH875> to draw <WH7579> water, and drew <WH7579> for all <WH3605> his camels. <WH1581>
And the man <WH376> wondering <WH7583> at her held <WH2790> his peace, <WH2790> to wit <WH3045> whether the LORD <WH3068> had made <WH6743> his journey <WH1870> prosperous <WH6743> or not.

And it came <WH1961> to pass, as the camels <WH1581> had done <WH3615> drinking, <WH8354> that the man <WH376> took <WH3947> a golden <WH2091> earring <WH5141> of half <WH1235> a shekel <WH1235> weight, <WH4948> and two <WH8147> bracelets <WH6781> for her hands <WH3027> of ten <WH6235> shekels weight <WH4948> of gold; <WH2091>
And said, <WH559> Whose <WH4310> daughter <WH1323> are you? tell <WH5046> me, I pray <WH4994> you: is there room <WH4725> in your father's <WH1> house <WH1004> for us to lodge <WH3885> in?
And she said <WH559> to him, I am the daughter <WH1323> of Bethuel <WH1328> the son <WH1121> of Milcah, <WH4435> which <WH834> she bore <WH3205> to Nahor. <WH5152>
She said <WH559> moreover to him, We have both <WH1571> straw <WH8401> and provender <WH4554> enough, <WH7227> and room <WH4725> to lodge <WH3885> in.
And the man <WH376> bowed <WH6915> down <WH6915> his head, and worshipped <WH7812> the LORD. <WH3068>

And he said, <WH559> Blessed <WH1288> be the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of my master <WH113> Abraham, <WH85> who <WH834> has not left <WH5800> destitute <WH5800> my master <WH113> of his mercy <WH2617> and his truth: <WH571> I being in the way, <WH1870> the LORD <WH3068> led <WH5148> me to the house <WH1004> of my master's <WH113> brothers. <WH251>
And the damsel <WH5291> ran, <WH7323> and told <WH5046> them of her mother's <WH517> house <WH1004> these <WH428> things. <WH1697>
And Rebekah <WH7259> had a brother, <WH251> and his name <WH8034> was Laban: <WH3837> and Laban <WH3837> ran <WH7323> out to the man, <WH376> to the well. <WH5869>

And it came <WH1961> to pass, when he saw <WH7200> the earring <WH5141> and bracelets <WH6781> on his sister's <WH269> hands, <WH3027> and when he heard <WH8085> the words <WH1697> of Rebekah <WH7259> his sister, <WH269> saying, <WH559> Thus <WH3541> spoke <WH1696> the man <WH376> to me; that he came <WH935> to the man; <WH376> and, behold, <WH2009> he stood <WH5975> by the camels <WH1581> at <WH5921> the well. <WH5869>

And he said, <WH559> Come <WH935> in, you blessed <WH1288> of the LORD; <WH3068> why <WH4100> stand <WH5975> you without? <WH2351> for I have prepared <WH6437> the house, <WH1004> and room <WH4725> for the camels. <WH1581>

And the man <WH376> came <WH935> into the house: <WH1004> and he ungirded <WH6605> his camels, <WH1581> and gave <WH5414> straw <WH8401> and provender <WH4554> for the camels, <WH1581> and water <WH4325> to wash <WH7364> his feet, <WH7272> and the men's <WH582> feet <WH7272> that were with him.

And there was set <WH7760> meat before <WH6440> him to eat: <WH398> but he said, <WH559> I will not eat, <WH398> until <WH5704> <WH515> I have told <WH1696> my errand. <WH1697> And he said, <WH559> Speak <WH1696> on.
And he said, <WH559> I am Abraham's <WH85> servant. <WH5650>

And the LORD <WH3068> has blessed <WH1288> my master <WH113> greatly; <WH3966> and he is become <WH1431> great: <WH1431> and he has given <WH5414> him flocks, <WH6629> and herds, <WH1241> and silver, <WH3701> and gold, <WH2091> and menservants, <WH5650> and maidservants, <WH8198> and camels, <WH1581> and asses. <WH2543>
And Sarah <WH8283> my master's <WH113> wife <WH802> bore <WH3205> a son <WH1121> to my master <WH113> when <WH310> she was old: <WH2209> and to him has he given <WH5414> all <WH3605> that he has.

And my master <WH113> made me swear, <WH7650> saying, <WH559> You shall not take <WH3947> a wife <WH802> to my son <WH1121> of the daughters <WH1323> of the Canaanites, <WH3669> in whose <WH834> land <WH776> I dwell: <WH3427>
But you shall go <WH3212> to my father's <WH1> house, <WH1004> and to my kindred, <WH4940> and take <WH3947> a wife <WH802> to my son. <WH1121>
And I said <WH559> to my master, <WH113> Peradventure <WH194> the woman <WH802> will not follow <WH3212> <WH310> me.

And he said <WH559> to me, The LORD, <WH3068> before <WH6440> whom <WH834> I walk, <WH1980> will send <WH7971> his angel <WH4397> with you, and prosper <WH6743> your way; <WH1870> and you shall take <WH3947> a wife <WH802> for my son <WH1121> of my kindred, <WH4940> and of my father's <WH1> house: <WH1004>

Then <WH227> shall you be clear <WH5352> from this my oath, <WH423> when you come <WH935> to my kindred; <WH4940> and if <WH518> they give <WH5414> not you one, you shall be clear <WH5355> from my oath. <WH423>

And I came <WH935> this day <WH3117> to the well, <WH5869> and said, <WH559> O LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of my master <WH113> Abraham, <WH85> if <WH518> now <WH4994> you do prosper <WH6743> my way <WH1870> which I go: <WH1980>

Behold, <WH2009> I stand <WH5324> by the well <WH5869> of water; <WH4325> and it shall come <WH1961> to pass, that when the virgin <WH5959> comes <WH3318> forth <WH3318> to draw <WH7579> water, and I say <WH559> to her, Give me, I pray <WH4994> you, a little <WH4592> water <WH4325> of your pitcher <WH3537> to drink; <WH8248>

And she say <WH559> to me, Both drink <WH8354> you, and I will also <WH1571> draw <WH7579> for your camels: <WH1581> let the same be the woman <WH802> whom <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> has appointed <WH3198> out for my master's <WH113> son. <WH1121>

And before <WH2962> I had done <WH3615> speaking <WH1696> in my heart, <WH3820> behold, <WH2009> Rebekah <WH7259> came <WH3318> forth <WH3318> with her pitcher <WH3537> on <WH5921> her shoulder; <WH7926> and she went <WH3381> down <WH3381> to the well, <WH5869> and drew <WH7579> water: and I said <WH559> to her, Let me drink, <WH8248> I pray <WH4994> you.

And she made haste, <WH4116> and let <WH3381> down <WH3381> her pitcher <WH3537> from her shoulder, and said, <WH559> Drink, <WH8354> and I will give your camels <WH1581> drink <WH8248> also: <WH1571> so I drank, <WH8354> and she made the camels <WH1581> drink <WH8354> also. <WH1571>

And I asked <WH7592> her, and said, <WH559> Whose <WH4310> daughter <WH1323> are you? And she said, <WH559> the daughter <WH1323> of Bethuel, <WH1328> Nahor's <WH5152> son, <WH1121> whom <WH834> Milcah <WH4435> bore <WH3205> to him: and I put <WH7760> the earring <WH5141> on her face, <WH639> and the bracelets <WH6781> on her hands. <WH3027>

And I bowed <WH6915> down <WH6915> my head, and worshipped <WH7812> the LORD, <WH3068> and blessed <WH1288> the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of my master <WH113> Abraham, <WH85> which <WH834> had led <WH5148> me in the right <WH571> way <WH1870> to take <WH3947> my master's <WH113> brother's <WH251> daughter <WH1323> to his son. <WH1121>

And now <WH6258> if <WH518> you will deal <WH6213> kindly <WH2617> and truly <WH571> with my master, <WH113> tell <WH5046> me: and if <WH518> not, tell <WH5046> me; that I may turn <WH6437> to the right <WH3225> hand, <WH3225> or <WH176> to the left. <WH8040>

Then Laban <WH3837> and Bethuel <WH1328> answered <WH6030> and said, <WH559> The thing <WH1697> proceeds <WH3318> from the LORD: <WH3068> we cannot <WH3808> <WH3201> speak <WH1696> to you bad <WH7451> or <WH176> good. <WH2896>

Behold, <WH2009> Rebekah <WH7259> is before <WH6440> you, take <WH3947> her, and go, <WH3212> and let her be your master's <WH113> son's <WH1121> wife, <WH802> as the LORD <WH3068> has spoken. <WH1696>
And it came <WH1961> to pass, that, when Abraham's <WH85> servant <WH5650> heard <WH8085> their words, <WH1697> he worshipped <WH7812> the LORD, <WH3068> bowing himself to the earth. <WH776>

And the servant <WH5650> brought <WH3318> forth <WH3318> jewels <WH3627> of silver, <WH3701> and jewels <WH3627> of gold, <WH2091> and raiment, <WH899> and gave <WH5414> them to Rebekah: <WH7259> he gave <WH5414> also to her brother <WH251> and to her mother <WH517> precious <WH4030> things. <WH1697>

And they did eat <WH398> and drink, <WH8354> he and the men <WH582> that were with him, and tarried <WH3885> all <WH3885> night; and they rose <WH6965> up in the morning, <WH1242> and he said, <WH559> Send <WH7971> me away to my master. <WH113>

And her brother <WH251> and her mother <WH517> said, <WH559> Let the damsel <WH5291> abide <WH3427> with us a few days, <WH3117> at <WH176> the least <WH176> ten; <WH6218> after <WH310> that she shall go. <WH3212>
And he said <WH559> to them, Hinder <WH309> me not, seeing the LORD <WH3068> has prospered <WH6743> my way; <WH1870> send <WH7971> me away that I may go <WH3212> to my master. <WH113>
And they said, <WH559> We will call <WH7121> the damsel, <WH5291> and inquire <WH7592> at her mouth. <WH6310>
And they called <WH7121> Rebekah, <WH7259> and said <WH559> to her, Will you go <WH3212> with this <WH2088> man? <WH376> And she said, <WH559> I will go. <WH3212>
And they sent <WH7971> away Rebekah <WH7259> their sister, <WH269> and her nurse, <WH3243> and Abraham's <WH85> servant, <WH5650> and his men. <WH582>

And they blessed <WH1288> Rebekah, <WH7259> and said <WH559> to her, You are our sister, <WH269> be you the mother of thousands <WH505> of millions, <WH7233> and let your seed <WH2233> possess <WH3423> the gate <WH8179> of those which hate <WH8130> them.

And Rebekah <WH7259> arose, <WH6965> and her damsels, <WH5291> and they rode <WH7392> on the camels, <WH1581> and followed <WH3212> <WH310> the man: <WH376> and the servant <WH5650> took <WH3947> Rebekah, <WH7259> and went <WH3212> his way. <WH3212>
And Isaac <WH3327> came <WH935> from the way <WH935> of the well <WH875> Lahairoi; <WH883> for he dwelled <WH3427> in the south <WH5045> country. <WH776>

And Isaac <WH3327> went <WH3318> out to meditate in the field <WH7704> at the eventide: <WH6256> <WH6153> and he lifted <WH5375> up his eyes, <WH5869> and saw, <WH7200> and, behold, <WH2009> the camels <WH1581> were coming. <WH935>
And Rebekah <WH7259> lifted <WH5375> up her eyes, <WH5869> and when she saw <WH7200> Isaac, <WH3327> she lighted <WH5307> off <WH5921> the camel. <WH1581>

For she had said <WH559> to the servant, <WH5650> What <WH4310> man <WH376> is this <WH1976> that walks <WH1980> in the field <WH7704> to meet <WH7125> us? And the servant <WH5650> had said, <WH559> It is my master: <WH113> therefore she took <WH3947> a veil, <WH6809> and covered <WH3680> herself.
And the servant <WH5650> told <WH5608> Isaac <WH3327> all <WH3605> things <WH1697> that he had done. <WH6213>

And Isaac <WH3327> brought <WH935> her into his mother <WH517> Sarah's <WH8283> tent, <WH168> and took <WH3947> Rebekah, <WH7259> and she became <WH1961> his wife; <WH802> and he loved <WH157> her: and Isaac <WH3327> was comforted <WH5162> after <WH310> his mother's <WH517> death.
